definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]

sentences.english: He was wearing a black blazer and white Nikes.
sentences.chinese: 他穿一件黑色运动夹克，脚蹬白色耐克鞋。

sentences.english: Always work from a secure position, keeping both feet on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 操作杠杆时务必保持双脚蹬地，占据安全位置。

sentences.english: She sank into the easy chair, put her feet up on the footstool, and allowed herself to doze off, just for a bit.
sentences.chinese: 她躺在安乐椅上，双脚搭在脚蹬上打个盹，就一会儿。

sentences.english: Tom went first, cutting rude steps in the clay hill as he descended.
sentences.chinese: 64汤姆先下，边往下走，边打一些粗糙的脚蹬儿。

definition: to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
pedal (in a car, on a piano etc)/treadle/footstool/footrest/footboard
to operate by means of a pedal
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
variant of 長筒靴|长筒靴[chang2 tong3 xue1]
